Aberrant Origins.name: Aberrant Origins
Aberrant Origins.description: As an Aberrant Mind sorcerer, you decide how you acquired your powers. Were you born with them? Or did an event later in life leave you shining with psionic awareness? Consult the Aberrant Origins options for a possible origin of your power.

results.1-1: You were exposed to the Far Realm’s warping influence. You are convinced that a tentacle is now growing on you, but no one else can see it.
results.2-2: A psychic wind from the Astral Plane carried psionic energy to you. When you use your powers, faint motes of light sparkle around you.
results.3-3: You once suffered the dominating powers of an aboleth, leaving a psychic splinter in your mind.
results.4-4: ou were implanted with a mind flayer tadpole, but the ceremorphosis never completed. And now its psionic power is yours. When you use it, your flesh shines with a strange mucus.
results.5-5: As a child, you had an imaginary friend that looked like a flumph or a strange platypus-like creature. One day, it gifted you with psionic powers, which have ended up being not so imaginary.
results.6-6: Your nightmares whisper the truth to you: your psionic powers are not your own. You draw them from your parasitic twin!

Aberration Desires.name: Aberration Desires
Aberration Desires.description: Some desired offering options for an aberration.

results.1-1: The brain or other organs of a rare creature
results.2-2: Flattery and obsequiousness
results.3-3: Secrets or lore it doesn’t already know
results.4-4: Accepting a strange, organic graft onto your body

results.1-1: Green Absorbing Tattoo
results.2-2: Blue Absorbing Tattoo
results.3-3: Red Absorbing Tattoo
results.4-4: White Absorbing Tattoo
results.5-5: Yellow Absorbing Tattoo
results.6-6: Black Absorbing Tattoo

results.1-1: Harried Functionary. A disinterested secretary conveys written correspondence to you from an exceptionally busy or aloof senior faculty member.
results.2-2: Celebrated Instructor. Despite their throngs of ambitious assistants, a celebrity researcher considers you their star pupil.
results.3-3: Wizened Fixture. A fantastically old, believed-to-be-deceased librarian gives you assignments from the circulation desk they never leave.
results.4-4: Infatuated Tourist. A flirtatious visiting scholar perceives your every report and donated discovery as a personal gift.
results.5-5: Spectral Fragment. A haunted piece of the academy’s collection compels you to complete its secret research.
results.6-6: Distant Observer. A mysterious sponsor encourages your research from afar to avoid alerting nefarious forces embedded within the academy’s bureaucracy.

results.1-1: Aberrant Zoology. You undertake expeditions to document, capture, and explain beings antithetical to the natural order.
results.2-2: Arcanodynamics. You investigate the ways magic underpins existence, exploring its flows and seeking ways to harness its nexuses.
results.3-3: Forbidden History. You reveal the lost truths of the world’s darkest ages, pursuing the history of purposefully hidden or taboo eras.
results.4-4: Cryptogeography. You search for proof of a hidden land or that the world isn’t structured as commonly assumed.
results.5-5: Restorative Antiquarianism. You track clues leading to plundered artifacts and then restore them to their rightful owners.
results.6-6: Evolutionary Divinity. You dare to explore what no mortal was meant to know: the origins of divinity.

results.1-1: Boarding School. Students and faculty enjoy a familial relationship on a self-contained campus.
results.2-2: Arcane Enclave. Drawn together by cutting-edge magical scholarship, the enclave’s residents are hungry for secrets, reagents, and subjects.
results.3-3: Secret Monastery. Ageless secrets remain the focus of contemplation and rigorous training at this site.
results.4-4: Elite Institute. This cutthroat college of science or the arts accepts only the crème de la crème of society and talent.
results.5-5: Vault of Secrets. This conspiracy strives to keep or eradicate all knowledge of a specific truth.
results.6-6: Museum of Dreams. Magical communication or shared dreamscapes connect a network of wide-ranging specialists.

results.1-1: Common Contact. A servant with ambitions toward a title works as a go-between for your patron.
results.2-2: Professional. A level-headed advisor or manager of your patron’s business directs you in keeping their reckless employer safe.
results.3-3: Family Peacemaker. A naive aristocrat appointed by your patron wants your assistance in keeping the peace between fractious family members, which isn’t your patron’s priority.
results.4-4: Intimate Connection. A common-born confidant or lover of your patron guides you in creating circumstances to bolster the noble family’s best interests.
results.5-5: Outside Insider. An outcast noble favored by your patron works with you to uphold their family’s interests despite their exile.
results.6-6: Outsider Inside. A mysterious entity manipulates a noble family’s fortunes. Through your patron, it employs you to help guide its chosen family along a centuries-long course.

results.1-1: Noble Union. You work within multiple noble factions to unite rival families.
results.2-2: Business Breakthrough. You track down and obtain a wonder your patron believes is the key to their financial fortunes.
results.3-3: Sabotage Rival. You break into the business or estate of an enemy noble family and undermine their political or professional ventures.
results.4-4: Lost Lineage. You seek evidence of a lost branch of a noble family or proof that individuals don’t possess a noble pedigree.
results.5-5: Origin of Nobility. You reveal the secret reason why certain individuals were elevated to noble status and how they will soon fulfill their purpose.
results.6-6: The New Nobility. You recreate the remarkable event that granted today’s noble families their special standing, enabling the rise of new nobles.

results.1-1: Local Lord. Convinced that power and prestige lie just around the corner, this minor lordling grasps for every opportunity to climb the ranks.
results.2-2: Merchant Mastermind. Reputation, wealth, and power are one and the same for the head of a family with world-spanning business holdings.
results.3-3: Nomadic Princeling. Nothing is more appealing to this princeling than treasure. Their sprawling merchant caravan trails behind their palanquin as far as the eye can see.
results.4-4: Double Dealer. The leader of a noble family has turned against their nation, secretly opposing their liege for personal gain or ethical reasons.
results.5-5: Ambitious Entrepreneur. The sole heir of a vast fortune, this entrepreneur seeks allies to expand their wealth in a new business on the international, global, or planar stage.
results.6-6: Future Ruler. This young noble is destined to rule, but currently their whims are fickle and dangerous.

Beast Desires.name: Beast Desires
Beast Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a beast.

results.1-1: Fresh meat
results.2-2: A soothing melody
results.3-3: Brightly colored beads, cloth, feathers, or string
results.4-4: An old stuffed animal or other soft trinket

results.1-1: Employer. An established member of local society acts as the interface between you and the patron and provides the cover of legitimate employment. They could be a bartender, shopkeeper, local official, or noble.
results.2-2: Back-Room Dealers. An exclusive area in an otherwise-ordinary establishment requires a password or token to gain entry. There you meet and communicate with shadowy agents of your patron.
results.3-3: Magical Message Drop. Magically recorded messages from your contact or your patron appear in odd places. You know to check a predetermined location, such as a crack in an ancient monolith or a specific grave, for instructions.
results.4-4: Visions. Your patron doesn’t use intermediaries, instead speaking to you in dreams, omens, or visions. The being appears in your mind as you sleep, taking control of your dreams to deliver instructions that become difficult to ignore.
results.5-5: Ephemeral Echo. Your contact never physically reveals itself to you. Perhaps it is the ghost of a dead person, an entity that appears outside the flow of time, or a projected illusion of a being that never leaves your patron’s hidden sanctum.
results.6-6: The Mouthpiece. The ancient being’s voice whispers through the lips of an ordinary person. You patron might posses the body of a stranger or a party member to converse with you.

results.1-1: Rescue. A wayward agent went missing while gathering information or materials. You must discover their fate and recover them and their findings.
results.2-2: Sabotage. You must destroy an aspect of a rival’s organization, either assassinating a key minion or destroying a critical object.
results.3-3: Artifice. Your specialized skills are instrumental to assembling components for a powerful magic ritual or object.
results.4-4: Treachery. A high-profile minion of another powerful figure is in a position to betray their master, to the benefit of your patron. You must convince them to defect to your organization or extract them from now-hostile territory.
results.5-5: Culling. A respected agent of your patron (possibly an ally or a mentor for your group) has been compromised. Perhaps they are defecting to a rival, attempting to seize the ancient being’s power. Whatever the case, you must catch them to end their threat.
results.6-6: Astral Heist. A powerful rival of your patron stores their secrets in a mind vault on the Astral Plane. That means they can’t be tricked or coerced into revealing anything, nor can their thoughts be read. You must find the vault and travel through the rival’s deadly memories to find the knowledge your patron desires.

results.1-1: Elder Dragon. An ancient dragon seeks knowledge or power. It wishes to gather greater wealth for its hoard, its ambitions expanding in its advancing years.
results.2-2: Lich. An undead spellcaster of immense power employs your group. Its interests are strangely diverse and seemingly benign. Perhaps it’s not as evil as conventional adventuring wisdom suggests?
results.3-3: Bound Fiend. This fiend is bound to a location, either in its true form or as a possessing spirit. Whether trapped in an unbreakable circle of binding sigils or sealed as a spirit within a gigantic statue, the fiend’s influence drives your group.
results.4-4: Guardian Celestial. An angel or another powerful celestial takes an interest in a specific region of the Material Plane. It cultivates a network of mortal informants and agents to serve its agenda.
results.5-5: The Endless. This person has lived many lifetimes because they can’t die—at least not permanently. No matter the cause of their demise, they return. To all appearances, they are alive and mortal, but they control the amassed resources of an immortal.
results.6-6: Primal Manifestation. Its existence defies mortal understanding; the being simply is. It could be a primordial force of nature awakened to self-awareness that now inhabits the landscape or an alien intellect that whispers through proxies, omens, and idols.

Blessed Radiance Effects.name: Blessed Radiance Effects
Blessed Radiance Effects.description: An effect that can occur when in a supernatural Blessed Radiance region.

results.1-6: Golden light fills a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on one character in the region and then fades. That character and their friends in the cylinder gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8MICCMeOXT3aJUy9]{divine favor} spell for 1 hour.
results.7-12: Radiant energy erupts in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on one random creature in the region. Each creature in the sphere that isn’t undead regains 3d6 hit points. Each undead creature in the sphere takes 3d6 radiant damage.
results.13-18: Aberrations, fiends, and undead in the region have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks for the next 24 hours.
results.19-24: Each creature carrying the holy symbol of a deity from a non-evil plane while in the region gains advantage on saving throws for the next 24 hours.
results.25-30: One character in the region is suffused with celestial power. For 1 minute, the character’s melee attacks deal an extra [[/damage 2d6 type=radiant]] damage on a hit.
results.31-36: One simple or martial weapon that is nonmagical and carried by one character in the region gains the properties of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.m7RubLd1lUcMjYgY]{mace of disruption} for 24 hours.
results.37-42: A flying, gleaming sword (use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.EqJUA3Z3181RSSFU]{flying sword} stat block which is configured with radiant damage) appears within 60 feet of an aberration, a fiend, or an undead, which becomes the sword’s target. The sword deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage and knows the exact location of its target while the target is within the region. The sword vanishes when it or its target is reduced to 0 hit points.
results.43-48: One character in the region hears whispers from celestial beings or refrains of celestial choirs. The character can ask those voices one question as if using the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.d54VDyFulD9xxY7J]{commune} spell.
results.49-54: Aberrations, fiends, and undead in the region give off a crimson glow for 1 minute. The creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius, attacks against them have advantage if the attacker can see them, and the creatures can’t benefit from being &Reference[invisible].
results.55-60: Celestial power explodes in a 30-foot-radius sphere of divine light centered on an aberration, a fiend, or an undead creature within the region. Each creature in the sphere must make a [[/save constitution dc=15]] saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes [[/damage 4d6 type=radiant]] damage and is &Reference[blinded]. On a success, it takes half damage and isn’t blinded.
results.61-66: One character in the region feels a profound sense of purpose and gains the benefit of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr]{bless} spell for 1 minute. They can choose two other creatures they can see to gain the spell’s benefits as well.
results.67-72: A booming voice thunders in Celestial and can be heard throughout the region. Each creature in the region must make a [[/save constitution dc=15]] saving throw. On a success, the creature gains [[/r 2d10]] temporary hit points. On a failure, the creature is &Reference[deafened] for 1 minute.
results.73-78: One character in the region gains the ability to cure afflictions for 1 hour. As an action, they can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{lesser restoration} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{greater restoration} without expending a spell slot and requiring no material components.
results.79-84: The effects of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SLxA9QhrggTz0taU]{hallow} spell (save DC 17), with one of its extra effects (DM’s choice), settle over the region for 24 hours.
results.85-90: An angelic voice rings throughout the region. Each creature there must succeed on a [[/save wisdom dc=15]] saving throw or perform the grovel option of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43]{command} spell.
results.91-95: One character in the region permanently gains resistance to necrotic damage. Reroll if you’ve already rolled this effect.
results.96-100: One character in the region gains the ability to use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.classfeatures.Item.eVXqHn0ojWrEuYGU]{Divine Intervention} cleric feature, which succeeds automatically. The character can use the feature granted in this way only once and must use it within 7 days. Reroll if you’ve already rolled this effect.

Celestial Desires.name: Celestial Desires
Celestial Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a celestial.

results.1-1: The tale of a heroic figure
results.2-2: An oath to do three charitable deeds before dawn
results.3-3: The crown of a defeated tyrant
results.4-4: A holy relic or treasured family heirloom

Construct Desires.name: Construct Desires
Construct Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a construct.

results.1-1: Oil to apply to the construct’s joints
results.2-2: A magic item with charges, to be used as fuel
results.3-3: A vessel infused with elemental power
results.4-4: Adamantine or mithral components

Dragon Desires.name: Dragon Desires
Dragon Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a dragon.

results.1-1: Gold or gems
results.2-2: Anything from a draconic rival’s hoard
results.3-3: An antique passed down at least three generations
results.4-4: A flattering artistic depiction of the dragon

Elemental Desires.name: Elemental Desires
Elemental Desires.description: Some desired offering options for an elemental.

results.1-1: A gem worth at least 50 gp, which the creature eats
results.2-2: An exceedingly pure sample of a favored element
results.3-3: A way to return the elemental to its home plane
results.4-4: Performing a dance from the elemental’s home plane

Elemental Essence and Property.name: Elemental Essence and Property
Elemental Essence and Property.description: Use this table to determine a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeElementalEss]{shard's} essence and property. When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use that property.

results.1-1: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeAirEssenceSh]{Air.} You can immediately fly up to 60 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.
results.2-2: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeEarthEssence]{Earth.} You gain &Reference[damageresistance]{resistance} to a damage type of your choice until the start of your next turn.
results.3-3: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeFireEssenceS]{Fire.} One target of the spell that you can see catches fire. The burning target takes [[/damage 2d10 type=fire]] damage at the start of its next turn, and then the flames go out.
results.4-4: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeWaterEssence]{Water.} You create a wave of water that bursts out from you in a 10-foot radius. Each creature of your choice that you can see in that area takes [[/damage 2d6 type=cold]] damage and must succeed on a [[/save ability=str]] saving throw against your spell save DC or be pushed 10 feet away from you and fall &Reference[prone].

Enchanted Spring Effects.name: Enchanted Spring Effects
Enchanted Spring Effects.description: Effects that can occur in an enchanted spring.

results.1-1: Any creature that touches or drinks the water of this spring feels blessed. The creature gains the benefits of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr]{bless} spell for 1 hour.
results.2-2: Bathing in the spring covers a creature with a glowing coat of golden feathers. While the creature isn’t wearing armor, the feathers grant a +1 bonus to AC. The feathers vanish after [[/r 1d4]] days.
results.3-3: A creature that touches or drinks the water of this spring develops an overwhelming desire to sing. Every sentence the creature speaks for the next 24 hours rings with lyrical splendor, which grants it advantage on all Charisma checks.
results.4-4: Bathing in the spring grants a creature the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{greater restoration} spell. As a side effect, the creature’s skin, hair, and eyes become a shimmering golden color for [[/r 1d4]] days.
results.5-5: Bathing in the spring grants a creature the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.KJRVzeMQXPj8Gtyx]{spider climb} spell for 24 hours.
results.6-6: A creature that touches or drinks the water of this spring grows the tail of its favorite animal. The tail is not under the creature’s control; it moves or reacts to emotions. The tail vanishes after 24 hours.
results.7-7: Any creature with an Intelligence score of 6 or higher that touches or drinks the water of this spring gains advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell once, requiring no components. The effects of the spring fade when either the spell is used or 24 hours pass, whichever happens first.
results.8-8: Bathing in the spring causes [[/r 1d10]] flowers to grow from a creature’s head. The flowers smell lovely, and they renew their vitality and scent every day. The flowers vanish after 7 days.
results.9-9: A creature that touches or drinks the water of this spring grows [[/r 1d4]] eyestalks. These eyestalks let the creature see in all directions and grant it advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. The eyestalks vanish after [[/r 1d4]] days.
results.10-10: Bathing in the spring causes a creature’s voice to sound sinister. For the next 24 hours, the creature’s voice grants it advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks and disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Persuasion) checks.
results.11-11: A creature that touches or drinks the water of this spring grows a set of donkey ears. The ears grant the creature advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. The ears vanish after [[/r 1d4]] days.
results.12-12: Bathing in the spring causes a creature to develop a third eye on its forehead. The eye grants the creature &Reference[truesight] out to a range of 60 feet. The eye vanishes after 24 hours.

results.1-1: Healing Elixir
results.2-2: Swiftness Elixir
results.3-3: Resilience Elixir
results.4-4: Boldness Elixir
results.5-5: Flight Elixir
results.6-6: Transformation Elixir

Extraplanar Reversal.name: Extraplanar Reversal
Extraplanar Reversal.description: Failing Matrix. Whenever the Crook of Rao’s Absolute Banishment property is used, or when its last charge is expended, roll on the Extraplanar Reversal table. Any creatures conjured as a result of this effect appear in random unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are not under your control.

results.1-25: A portal to a random plane opens. The portal closes after 5 minutes.
results.86-90: 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.uZ8NrRenwYZ4qNf6]{balor} and 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.RCv5y7iWlfNxkinx]{pit fiend} appear. At the DM’s discretion, a portal opens into the presence of an archdevil or demon lord instead, then closes after 5 minutes.
results.91-100: Iggwilv’s Curse (see the Iggwilv’s Curse property).

Far Realm Effects: Creatures.name: Far Realm Effects: Creatures
Far Realm Effects: Creatures.description: Options that can occur as part of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-tables.RollTable.tcoeFarRealmEffe]{Far Realm Effect}.

results.1-2: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.OVikYmSdHliAG2YD]{insect plague} spell is centered on one random creature in the region.
results.3-4: [[/r 1d4]] swarms of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.LPdX5YLlwci0NDZx]{ravens} and [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.8ihbbjkaOFTPbI73]{swarms of rats} gather and attack any other creatures in the region.
results.5-6: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.NB6wUgVqeOQtsQKu]{treant} (in forested terrain) or a galeb duhr (in rockier terrain) attacks.

Far Realm Effects.name: Far Realm Effects
Far Realm Effects.description: An effect that can occur when in a supernatural Far Realm region.

results.1-9: A structure in the region whispers faintly. Any creature within 60 feet of the structure that can hear it must succeed on a [[/save wisdom dc=12]] saving throw or be &Reference[charmed]. While charmed in this way, the creature must move toward the source of the whispering, avoiding obvious hazards. When it reaches the source, it is &Reference[incapacitated]. The creature can repeat the saving throw when it takes damage and at the end of every hour, ending the effect on itself on a success.
results.10-18: An elder evil turns its attention to the region, imposing the pressure of its unfathomable presence upon the place. Any creature that finishes a rest in the region must succeed on a [[/save charisma dc=12]] saving throw, or it gains no benefit from finishing the rest. It instead finds strange scrawls, stacked stones, or its belongings arranged in intricate, abstruse patterns nearby.
results.28-36: Distance no longer functions in a comprehensible manner within the region. Creatures make ranged attack rolls with disadvantage, and the range of those attacks is halved.
results.37-45: The landscape melts into a mass of writhing flesh, eyes, and fanged mouths. From an unoccupied space in the fleshy ground arise [[/r 1d4 + 5]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.8pX2JhWUpTNNRBVx]{gibbering mouthers} that attack anyone in sight.
results.46-54: Unintelligible murmurings threaten to overcome the mind of one random creature within the region. At the start of the creature’s turn, it must succeed on a [[/save intelligence dc=13]] saving throw or use its action to make one melee attack against the nearest creature it can see. If there are no other creatures within reach, the target spends its action babbling.
results.55-63: Bizarre appendages squirm beneath the ground and around trees or other structures within this region. Dozens of limbs burst forth, entangling anyone within a 30-foot sphere surrounding one random creature. Each creature in the sphere must succeed on a [[/save dexterity dc=14]] saving throw or take [[/damage 3d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage and be &Reference[restrained]. Any creature that ends its turn in the area takes [[/damage 3d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage. A creature can free itself or someone else within reach from being restrained in this way by using an action to make a successful [[/check strength dc=14]] or [[/check dexterity dc=14]] check (its choice).
results.64-72: Creatures in the region can’t leave it and find themselves covering the same ground over and over. By the time they realize this, [[/r 2d10]] hours have passed, during which they have made no progress in their effort to leave. The effect then ends, and each creature must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=10]] saving throw or gain 1 level of &Reference[exhaustion].
results.73-79: One random creature in the region hears strange whispers and must succeed on a [[/save wisdom dc=14]] saving throw or become &Reference[charmed]. While charmed in this way, the creature focuses on copying the blasphemous designs that appear in its mind using whatever medium it has available (ink, charcoal, mud, or its own blood). Unless &Reference[restrained], the creature completes the designs in 1 hour of work. When the creature finishes its work, it is no longer charmed, and a death slaad appears within 30 feet of it and attacks anyone in sight.
results.80-85: Natural features and structures in this region writhe to spell out words and form strange symbols. Any creature that tries to read the messages must make a [[/check skill=arc dc=20]] check. On a success, the creature gains insight as if it had cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dSTu1MaPhBqPITwM]{contact other plane} spell. On a failure, the creature is affected as if it failed a saving throw against the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{confusion} spell. This effect ends at the end of the creature’s next turn.
results.86-90: In this region, circular things (such as buttons, crystal balls, the sun, and so on) seem appallingly wrong. One random creature that starts its turn in this region must succeed on a [[/save intelligence dc=14]] saving throw or spend their turn loudly trying to destroy these objects.
results.91-95: Glaring eyes, which weep viscid tears, appear on inanimate objects throughout the region. These eyes watch the characters, and creatures within the region can’t be surprised by the characters for as long as the eyes exist. An eye closes and disappears if it takes any damage. Reroll if you’ve already rolled this effect.
results.96-100: A tear in reality creates a rift in the region, similar to the spell gate, that passes through the Far Realm and connects with a random plane. Any creature that enters the rift takes [[/damage 10d10 type=psychic]] from the horrors of the Far Realm and appears in an empty space closest to the rift’s opening on another random plane. The rift vanishes after [[/r 2d10 + 2]] hours.

Fey Desires.name: Fey Desires
Fey Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a fey.

results.1-1: The memory of your first kiss
results.2-2: The color of your eyes
results.3-3: An object of deep sentimental value to you
results.4-4: Reciting a sublime poem

Feywild Gifts.name: Feywild Gifts
Feywild Gifts.description: As a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-character-options.Item.tcoeFeyWanderer0]{Fey Wanderer}, you also possess a preternatural blessing from a fey ally or a place of fey power. Choose your blessing from this table or determine it randomly.

results.1-1: Illusory butterflies flutter around you while you take a short or long rest.
results.2-2: Fresh, seasonal flowers sprout from your hair each dawn.
results.3-3: You faintly smell of cinnamon, lavender, nutmeg, or another comforting herb or spice.
results.4-4: Your shadow dances while no one is looking directly at it.
results.5-5: Horns or antlers sprout from your head.
results.6-6: Your skin and hair change color to match the season at each dawn.

Fiend Desires.name: Fiend Desires
Fiend Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a fiend.

results.1-1: Your soul
results.2-2: A desecrated holy object
results.3-3: Blood from a living or recently slain loved one
results.4-4: Breaking a sacred promise in the fiend’s presence

Genie Kind.name: Genie Kind
Genie Kind.description:
You have made a pact with one of the rarest kinds of genie, a noble genie. Such entities rule vast fiefs on the Elemental Planes and have great influence over lesser genies and elemental creatures. Noble genies are varied in their motivations, but most are arrogant and wield power that rivals that of lesser deities. They delight in turning the table on mortals, who often bind genies into servitude, and readily enter into pacts that expand their reach.

You choose your patron’s kind or determine it randomly, using the below options.

results.1-1: Kind: Dao. Element: Earth.
results.2-2: Kind: Djinii. Element: Air.
results.3-3: Kind: Efreeti. Element: Fire.
results.4-4: Kind: Marid. Element: Water.

Genie's Vessel.name: Genie's Vessel
Genie's Vessel.description: Your patron gifts you a magical vessel that grants you a measure of the genie’s power. The vessel is a Tiny object, and you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells. You decide what the object is, or you can determine what it is randomly by rolling on the table below:

results.1-1: Oil lamp
results.2-2: Urn
results.3-3: Ring with a compartment
results.4-4: Stoppered bottle
results.5-5: Hollow statuette
results.6-6: Ornate lantern

Giant Desires.name: Giant Desires
Giant Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a giant.

results.1-1: A dwarf admitting giant-craft to be superior to dwarf-craft
results.2-2: A strong working animal
results.3-3: Multiple barrels of ale
results.4-4: Treasure stolen from a rival giant

results.1-1: The Perfectionist. Your contact is a skilled but obsessive creator consumed with the quest to create something perfect that will define their life’s work and secure their legacy. They lose sight of right and wrong in pursuit of the finest materials and exciting opportunities.
results.2-2: Attentive Overseer. A guild representative takes personal interest in your group’s tasks. They follow your exploits and know of your adventures before you return to report. Despite the unsettling depth of their knowledge, they seem genuinely eager to shepherd your work.
results.3-3: Hidden Benefactor. Whoever your contact is, they don’t communicate directly. They send messages via couriers or letters. No one in the guild knows who the contact is, or if they do, they aren’t telling you. Regardless, the contact’s information is good, and they pay on time.
results.4-4: Discerning Mentor. No matter how well you perform, or how perfect your creations, nothing is ever good enough for this contact. They point out every flaw and missed opportunity. Are they bitter, lashing out at anyone around them, or do they recognize your potential and try to push you to greatness?
results.5-5: Golem Guide. Your guild contact is the soul of a long-dead artisan preserved in a construct body. This golem is wise and knowledgeable, but it has difficulty grasping the passage of time and the state of the world compared to its original era.
results.6-6: Fallen Muse. Your contact is a fallen celestial. Whether they regret their transgressions or hunger for vengeance, they provide divine inspiration and guidance to you and to the guild. Somehow your group and the guild inspire their hope for ascension.

results.1-1: Deliver Goods. You need to deliver an order to an important customer or partner of the guild. The delivery must arrive by a critical deadline—regardless of who or what tries to stop you.
results.2-2: Acquire Materials. Your guild requires materials that are rare and difficult to procure, either for a guild project or for a paying client. Your group must gather the missing components from a dangerous location or a recalcitrant owner while outpacing a rival to the prize.
results.3-3: Eliminate a Rival. A competitor has humiliated the guild one too many times, and it’s time for that to stop. Your group is charged with ensuring the rival never besmirches the guild’s reputation again. Can you trick them into permanent disgrace, or must you resort to more direct methods?
results.4-4: The Masterpiece. An exquisite work of art for an influential client, either created by your guild or acquired through agents, has gone missing. You must track down its whereabouts and secure it before time runs out and the guild suffers a penalty.
results.5-5: The Collector. Your guild is tasked to create or acquire something wondrous for a wealthy but secretive client’s collection. Guild members who previously failed to fulfill this assignment ended up missing. The collector promises to return your comrades if you provide what the collector seeks, but if you fail, you’ll become part of the collection.
results.6-6: The Bill Comes Due. Your guild master achieved their vaunted position by means of an otherworldly bargain. That price has come due, and they are desperate to avoid paying. You must defeat whatever’s coming to collect the master’s debt or find another acceptable payment.

results.1-1: Crafters’ Guild. This conglomerate of artisans pools its resources and influence to ensure a steady exchange of gold for its crafts.
results.2-2: Merchant Consortium. These entrepreneurs don’t create the wares they peddle, instead specializing in linking products to prospective owners. If they don’t have it, they find it.
results.3-3: Miracle Makers’ Association. The magically inclined crafters of this guild specialize in imbuing physical goods with magical effects. Rumor has it they can strip the magic from existing enchanted items and might be willing to buy or trade adventurers’ spoils.
results.4-4: Moneychangers. These merchants deal in all forms of currency, acting as bankers, loan agents, and crucial contacts for adventurers and other individuals who deal with large sums of wealth. They exchange coin for gemstones as readily as they find buyers for historical relics and recovered art.
results.5-5: Philosophical Faction. These like-minded individuals follow specific teachings, spreading word of their expertise through their services and training.
results.6-6: Identity Traders. These enigmatic dealers buy and sell documents, memories, and the trappings of thoroughly lived lives, selling them to those in need of the ultimate fresh start.

Haunted Effects.name: Haunted Effects
Haunted Effects.description: An effect that can occur when in a supernatural Haunted region.

results.1-5: A violent thunderstorm begins, centered over the region. It doesn’t end until the party leaves the region.
results.6-10: A random building in the region gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yw0tYQkOMCgKZ8Ur]{guards and wards} spell (save DC 13) for the next 24 hours.
results.11-15: A mundane part of one random character’s surroundings—perhaps a tree bole or a stuffed animal head—animates for 1 minute and whispers a warning or threatens to reveal one of the character’s secrets.
results.16-20: All bright light weakens to dim light for 24 hours. Sources that provide dim light, such as candles, do not shed any light.
results.21-25: The temperature in the region drops by 10 degrees Fahrenheit every hour for the next [[/r 1d6]] hours, after which the temperature returns to normal. If cold enough, ice crystals form in sinister patterns.
results.26-30: One random creature’s shadow acts independently for the next 24 hours. The shadow acts out of sync with its owner, perhaps dramatically choking or trying to murder another shadow.
results.31-35: After the next sunset, the sun doesn’t rise again for 36 hours. During this time, the sky over the region might hold a crimson moon, be obscured by roiling fog, or display blinking, alien stars.
results.36-40: During the next night, one random sleeping creature vanishes and reappears approximately a foot beneath where they were sleeping—typically buried in undisturbed dirt or in a space beneath floorboards. The creature or someone else can free it with a successful [[/check skill=ath dc=13]] check.
results.41-45: One random creature in the region is targeted by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MRxldJd6C4bsBo3O]{levitate} spell (save DC 15) for 1 minute.
results.46-50: A nonviolent but unsettling @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{ghost}—perhaps a pet, an accident-prone child, or a dismembered big toe—appears and follows one random creature for 24 hours before vanishing. The ghost vanishes if reduced to 0 hit points.
results.51-55: One player character’s appearance changes for the next 24 hours to reflect the region’s haunted history. For example, they might manifest the distinctive facial scar associated with a notorious tyrant who died in the region.
results.56-60: For the next 24 hours, any humanoid killed in the region rapidly decomposes and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeleton} [[/r 1d10]] minutes after dying.
results.61-65: Over the next 24 hours, whenever any creature is wounded, its blood (or similar fluid) spreads to form a short message or grisly tableau.
results.66-70: A spirit inhabits one character’s simple or martial weapon, making it a sentient magic item until the character leaves the region. Randomly generate the item’s properties as described in the “Sentient Magic Items” section of the Dungeon Master’s Guide.
results.71-75: A spectral force manifests to one character in the region, allowing them to ask one question and receive a short answer as through the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{augury} spell. The force manifests as a planchette moving on a talking board, writing on foggy glass, or insects swarming to create messages.
results.76-80: During the next night, one sleeping character in the region receives a vision as if the target of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.kSPRpeIx3w3nihrF]{dream} spell. The dream is brief and unsettling, revealing some element of the environment’s history and putting the character in the place of someone who suffered a grim fate there.
results.81-85: A coffin or small enclosed space in the region—perhaps an antique box, stone cairn, or tree stump sealed with rocks—radiates palpable malice. The first time a creature opens it, roll a die ([[/r 1d2]]. If you roll an even number, the creature receives a terrible vision and is &Reference[frightened] of all creatures for the next 24 hours. If you roll an odd number, an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.XiSWKZzAUxdmFOLL]{avatar of death} appears and attacks as though summoned by the Skull card from a deck of many things.
results.86-90: Over the next 24 hours, whenever any creature in the region regains hit points from a spell, the healing magic leaves scars. This might be accompanied by a purging of black bile or a spectral force tearing free from the creature. These scars can be removed only by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{greater restoration} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{wish}.
results.91-95: For 24 hours, a luminous wisp of vapor floats above a corpse or grave in the region. If the wisp is put in a container, a creature holding the receptacle can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO]{resurrection} spell once, requiring no components and causing the wisp to vanish. Any creature returned to life in this way experiences strange dreams.
results.96-100: A mysterious mist rises from the shadows. This dense fog heavily obscures everything in a 50-foot-radius sphere around one random creature in the region. Any creature that starts its turn in the mist must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=10]] saving throw or gain 1 level of &Reference[exhaustion]. This exhaustion can’t be removed while the creature is in the mist. Additionally, creatures notice unsettling sights through the fog, such as ominous ruins or soundless silhouettes fleeing pursuit. The mists can’t be dispersed by any wind, but clear after 1 minute.

Humanoid Desires.name: Humanoid Desires
Humanoid Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a humanoid.

results.1-1: Promising to find a lost item of great importance to their culture
results.2-2: Challenging them to a type of friendly contest, such as dancing, singing, or drinking
results.3-3: Recovering something they’ve lost
results.4-4: Information on a foe’s secrets or weaknesses

Infested Effects.name: Infested Effects
Infested Effects.description: An effect that can occur when in a supernatural Infected region.

results.1-5: Intense buzzing or grinding noises fill the region for the next 24 hours. With the exception of truly cacophonous sounds, creatures can only hear speech and noises that originate within 10 feet of them.
results.6-10: A mass migration of insects begins, with waves of Tiny bugs crawling over everything in the region. Creatures cannot take a short or long rest in the region for the next 24 hours.
results.11-15: A swarm of bioluminescent flies converges on one random creature in the region. For the next minute, the creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius, any attack against it has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the creature can’t benefit from being &Reference[invisible].
results.16-20: A boil of termites bursts from the ground, along with dozens of bones and a treasure of the DM’s choice (see “Random Treasure” in the Dungeon Master’s Guide).
results.21-25: A cricket-shaped creature with the statistics of a cat bounds up to one random creature and follows it like an affectionate pet for 24 hours before scampering off.
results.26-30: A cluster of [[/r 1d4 + 2]] faintly glowing grubs appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the party. Any creature that consumes one of these succulent grubs receives the benefits of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.ytlsBjYsZ7OBSEBs]{potion of healing}.
results.31-35: A large, psychedelically colored moth flies over the party, dusting the characters with strange powder. Creatures the moth flies over must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=16]] saving throw or be &Reference[charmed] by all creatures for 1 hour.
results.36-45: The region is choked with wispy webbing, which acts as &Reference[difficult-terrain].
results.46-50: Nearly every surface is covered with discarded cicada-like shells that crunch loudly when trod upon, imposing disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while moving across them. The shells vanish after 1 hour.
results.51-55: A massive, bloated maggot emerges from the ground within 10 feet of the party and bursts, covering the ground with ichor in a 10-foot square centered on it. This region is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.etgcR9wqmrhyZ0tx]{grease} spell ([[/save dex dc=13]] saving throw) for 1 minute.
results.56-60: The ground opens up beneath one random creature, creating a quicksand pit (see the Dungeon Master’s Guide).
results.61-65: One random creature in the region must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=16]] saving throw or contract the sight rot disease (see the Dungeon Master’s Guide) from minute parasites.
results.66-70: Dung-colored bugs cover the ground. Creatures that move at half their normal walking speed can ignore the bugs. Those that move faster must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=16]] saving throw or become &Reference[poisoned] until the start of their next turn. A creature poisoned in this way has its speed reduced to 0, as it is overcome by the squashed insects’ foul smell. Creatures that don’t need to breathe automatically succeed on this saving throw.
results.71-75: One of the characters in the region must succeed on a [[/save wisdom dc=15]] saving throw or be transformed into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-actors.Actor.v99wOosUJjUgcUNF]{giant spider}, as if by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{polymorph} spell. The spell lasts for 1 hour or until dispelled.
results.76-80: One random creature in the region must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=16]] saving throw, or it acquires a ravenous silverfish infestation among its gear. The infestation is discovered the next time the creature finishes a short or long rest. If the creature has any paper material, the silverfish destroy one random book or other paper item that isn’t magical.
results.81-85: One random creature in the region must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=16]] saving throw or become host to a particularly aggressive tapeworm. The affected creature gains no benefit from eating until it receives treatment that removes a disease. A creature immune to disease automatically succeeds on this saving throw.
results.86-90: Biting mites infest creatures’ clothing in the region. Any creature wearing medium or heavy armor has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for the next 24 hours.
results.91-95: Tiny arachnids invade unattended spaces. The next time one random creature in the region dons its clothing or armor after finishing a long rest, it must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=16]] saving throw or take [[/damage 2d10 type=poison average=true]] damage.
results.96-100: Countless tiny, bloodsucking insects infest the region for the next [[/r 1d6]] hours. Every hour, each creature in the region must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=10]] saving throw or gain 1 level of &Reference[exhaustion]. The insects don’t affect creatures that are immune to disease.

Magic Mushroom Effects.name: Magic Mushroom Effects
Magic Mushroom Effects.description: Effects that can occur from interacting with magic mushrooms.

results.1-1: The creature’s skin turns an unusual color. Roll [[/r 1d4]]: 1, purple with yellow splotches; 2, bright orange with tiger stripes; 3, tree-frog green with red squiggles; 4, hot pink with yellow spots. This change is permanent unless removed by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{greater restoration} spell or similar magic.
results.2-2: The creature gains the enlarge or reduce effect (50 percent chance of either) of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WahI41a3goVUg0x1]{enlarge/reduce} spell for 1 hour.
results.3-3: The creature regains [[/r 5d8 + 20]] hit points.
results.4-4: Vocally, the creature can only cluck and croon like a chicken. The creature can also understand and speak to chickens. This curse lasts for 1 hour unless ended by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{remove curse} spell or similar magic.
results.5-5: The creature can understand and speak all languages for [[/r 1d4]] days.
results.6-6: The creature gains the benefits of the telepathy spell for the next 24 hours.
results.7-7: The creature gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2VXGS206tuChoeXy]{speak with plants} spell for 8 hours.
results.8-8: The creature immediately casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JYuRBwxpoFhXduvD]{time stop} spell, requiring no components. Constitution is the spellcasting ability for this spell.
results.9-9: The creature immediately casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell, requiring no components. Constitution is the spellcasting ability for this spell.
results.10-10: Magical mists pour out of the creature’s eyes and ears, acting as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{fog cloud} spell for 1 hour that is centered on the creature and moves with it.

results.1-1: Book pages, origami, quills, and ink, all accompanied by rustling sounds and library scents
results.2-2: Brine-scented shapes of sharks, jellyfish, octopuses, and other sea creatures
results.3-3: Food or utensils that carry the scent of cuisine from the spellcaster’s homeland
results.4-4: Rich, copper scents accompanied by what appears to be the caster’s own imbalanced humors
results.5-5: Bursts and strokes of watercolor painted by an invisible brush
results.6-6: Transparent weapons, armor, miniature war machines, and phantom soldiers
results.7-7: Golden rays that carry faint warmth and the hint of windblown sand
results.8-8: Rowdy barnyard animals accompanied by the warm scents of coops and stables
results.9-9: Manifestations of deep emotions, like the faint shackles of melancholy, sepia shades of nostalgia, or heart-shaped bursts of affection
results.10-10: Tiny whimsical or fearsome beings from the spellcaster’s inescapable, recurring dreams

Manifestations of Order.name: Manifestations of Order
Manifestations of Order.description: Choose or randomly determine a way your connection to order manifests while you are casting any of your sorcerer spells.

results.1-1: Spectral cogwheels hover behind you.
results.2-2: The hands of a clock spin in your eyes.
results.3-3: Your skin glows with a brassy sheen.
results.4-4: Floating equations and geometric objects overlay your body.
results.5-5: Your spellcasting focus temporarily takes the form of a Tiny clockwork mechanism.
results.6-6: The ticking of gears or ringing of a clock can be heard by you and those affected by your magic.

Merciful Mask.name: Merciful Mask
Merciful Mask.description: A selection of mask options for the Way of Mercy Monk subclass.

results.1-1: Raven
results.2-2: Blank and white
results.3-3: Cry visage
results.4-4: Laughing visage
results.5-5: Skull
results.6-6: Butterfly

results.1-1: Tested Veteran. Your commander is a battle-scarred officer who experienced horrors in combat. They rely on something to dull the pain of their memories or wounds, from a favorite writer’s prose to a distracting vice.
results.2-2: Taskmaster. This angry officer yells every order, reprimands you for the smallest mistake, and fully expects you to fail at every mission you undertake. This might be tough love or simple brutishness.
results.3-3: Protective Officer. A kindly officer is hesitant to send you into danger and constantly reminds you to be careful.
results.4-4: Bitter Soldier. Your commander carries deep grudges against your force’s enemies. They leap at any chance to do those foes harm, even if it puts your group in terrible risk.
results.5-5: Hopeful Commander. This optimistic officer knows that a new era of peace is just over the horizon. You just need to complete these last few missions, then it should all finally be over.
results.6-6: Devout Leader. Your commander is a person of deep faith. They believe that your success or failure lies entirely in divine hands and you are the instruments of that will.

results.1-1: Strike Force. You undertake a quick, strategic, and devastating attack against an enemy force.
results.2-2: Defensive Operations. You must preserve the safety of an important location such as a civilian population center, a supply depot, or strategically critical bridge or seaport.
results.3-3: Special Forces. You are assigned to a covert operation behind enemy lines. This is similar to the work of a spy or an assassin but with a broader scope. You engage in equipment sabotage or execute targeted strikes against high-value targets.
results.4-4: Reconnaissance. You gather information on enemy troop numbers, placements, movement, or supply caches and routes.
results.5-5: Seek and Destroy. You are responsible for hunting down specific high-value and dangerous targets, which include deserters, suspected enemy special forces, or magical war machines run amok.
results.6-6: Siege. You are assigned to initiate a siege on an enemy stronghold or help break a siege in progress on an allied fortress.

results.1-1: Standing Army. A standing army serves as the highly disciplined and structured guardian of a province or an entire nation. Strict tiers of command ensure coordination between branches of the force.
results.2-2: Mercenary Company. Hard-bitten veterans of numerous conflicts, mercenaries serve an employer for coin rather than out of loyalty.
results.3-3: Expeditionary Force. This military force is far from home, fighting behind enemy lines or striking into wild, unsettled lands. The force must be fast, self-sufficient, and either diplomatic or decisive to assure their survival.
results.4-4: Horde. The horde is almost a force of nature, and what it lacks in discipline it makes up in ferocity. It doesn’t have a rigid command structure, instead functioning like a pyramid of smaller armies. Horde commanders owe fealty to stronger leaders above them, all the way up to the warlord.
results.5-5: Planar Conscripts. This military force battles for cosmic stakes on far-flung planes of the multiverse or fights against extraplanar invasion on the Material Plane. Warriors include conscripts pressed into service in the Blood War, fodder in the thrall of ruthless yugoloth mercenaries, or members of a glorious celestial host defending against fiendish incursion.
results.6-6: Sky Warriors. This military force consists of winged creatures, employs magical flight, or sails airships as a sky navy. Traditional defenses are ineffective against attacks from the air, positioning the sky warriors as a fearsome nation or expensive and coveted mercenaries.

Mirror Zone Effects.name: Mirror Zone Effects
Mirror Zone Effects.description: An effect that can occur when in a supernatural Mirror Zone region.

results.1-6: Creatures in the region begin to display features other than their own for the next 24 hours. During that time, affected creatures have advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks and ability checks made to disguise themselves.
results.7-12: The @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.sTIkQK7KuQNOyY0C]{hallucinatory terrain} spell ([[/check skill=investigation dc=15]]) affects the natural terrain of the region, changing it into a different kind of terrain (DM’s choice).
results.13-18: One random creature in the region gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GSvLWcdCZLQkilXT]{blink} spell for 1 minute, shimmering with overlapping shattered reflections.
results.19-24: Creatures in the region don’t cast reflections. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against those creatures have disadvantage, and the creatures have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made against anyone who notices their lack of reflection. When they leave the region, creatures regain their reflections, and the effect ends.
results.25-34: Reflections of [[/r 1d4]] creatures in the region emerge from mirrors and attack. The reflections are two-dimensional, shimmering versions of the creatures that cast them. Treat the reflections as shadows that are fey instead of undead and vulnerable to bludgeoning damage instead of radiant.
results.35-40: One character in the region gains the benefit of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.X4c8xCkmF8U9HUMz]{mirror image} spell. The images created sometimes move or speak of their own volition.
results.41-46: For the next 24 hours, certain wounds caused in the region attract spectral slivers of glass that cause extra damage. Any creature, other than a construct or an undead, hit by an attack that deals piercing or slashing damage begins to bleed, losing [[/damage 1d4]] hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the bleeding creature is hit by another such attack, the bleeding increases by [[/r 1d4]]. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful [[/check skill=medicine dc=10]] check. The bleeding also stops if the target receives magical healing.
results.47-52: Mirrors and other highly reflective surfaces allow magical transport while in the region. Any creature that touches its reflection in an object that it isn’t wearing or carrying can immediately cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{misty step} spell, requiring no components.
results.53-58: One character can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20]{scrying} spell ([[/save wisdom dc=17]]) once within the next 24 hours, requiring no components but using a mirror or other reflective surface.
results.59-64: The skin of one random creature in the region becomes silvery and reflective for the next 24 hours. For the duration, that creature has advantage on saving throws against spells, and spell attacks have disadvantage against that creature.
results.65-70: A longsword or shortsword with a blade made of a jagged mirror appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of a random creature in the region. The weapon is a sword of wounding (see the Dungeon Master’s Guide). If the weapon’s wielder rolls a 1 or 20 on an attack roll using the weapon, the weapon shatters and is destroyed after that attack.
results.71-76: For the next 24 hours, when anyone in the region hits a creature with an attack roll and deals damage to it, the attacker must succeed on a [[/save charisma dc=13]] saving throw or take force damage equal to half the damage dealt.
results.77-82: Two shimmering, vertical, reflective disks of energy appear in unoccupied spaces in the region for 1 minute. Each is 6 feet in diameter and floats 1 foot above the ground. One appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the party. Any creature that moves through the disk instantly appears within 5 feet of the other disk or the nearest unoccupied space.
results.83-88: The next time one character in the party sees their reflection in the region, that reflection of comes to life and engages its counterpart in conversation. It offers to answer one question posed to it as if the creature cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XqzXSKNR75ZdYTA9]{divination} spell. After answering the question, the reflection returns to normal.
results.89-94: Floating shards of broken mirrors swirl through the region, showing reflections of creatures and places that aren’t present, for the next minute before vanishing. On initiative count 20 (losing all ties), the shards make a ranged weapon attack (+6 to hit) against one random creature in the region. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage 3d6 type=slashing average=true]] damage.
results.95-100: A duplicate of one random creature in the region appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of that creature. The duplicate’s appearance, game statistics, and equipment are identical to the creature’s. The duplicate immediately attacks the creature, seeking to slay it. If the duplicate dies, it and all its equipment shatter into mirror shards. If the duplicate fails to slay the creature within 1 hour, the duplicate vanishes.

Monstrosity Desires.name: Monstrosity Desires
Monstrosity Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a monstrosity.

results.1-1: Dislodging the stuck scraps of the creature’s last meal
results.2-2: The creature’s favorite food
results.3-3: Driving off the creature’s rival
results.4-4: Making movements that mimic the monster’s mating dance

Ooze Desires.name: Ooze Desires
Ooze Desires.description: Some desired offering options for an ooze.

results.1-1: A vial of putrid liquids
results.2-2: A cloth bearing a noxious odor
results.3-3: Bones or metal, which the ooze promptly absorbs
results.4-4: A gallon of any effervescent fluid

Origin of the Beast.name: Origin of the Beast
Origin of the Beast.description: Such a barbarian might be inhabited by a primal spirit or be descended from shape-shifters. You can choose the origin of your feral might or determine it by rolling on this table.

results.1-1: One of your parents is a lycanthrope, and you’ve inherited some of their curse.
results.2-2: You are descended from an archdruid and inherited the ability to partially change shape.
results.3-3: A fey spirit gifted you with the ability to adopt different bestial aspects.
results.4-4: An ancient animal spirit dwells within you, allowing you to walk this path.

Outer Essence and Property.name: Outer Essence and Property
Outer Essence and Property.description: Use this table to determine a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeOuterEssence]{shard's} essence and property. When you use a Metamagic option on a spell while you are holding or wearing the shard, you can use that property.

results.1-1: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeLawfulEssenc]{Lawful.} You can end one of the following conditions affecting yourself or one creature you can see within 30 feet of you: charmed, blinded, deafened, frightened, poisoned, or stunned.
results.2-2: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeChaoticEssen]{Chaotic.} Choose one creature who takes damage from the spell. That target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks made before the start of your next turn.
results.3-3: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeGoodEssenceS]{Good.} You or one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you gains 3d6 temporary hit points.
results.4-4: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-tashas-cauldron.tcoe-magic-items.Item.tcoeEvilEssenceS]{Evil.} Choose one creature who takes damage from the spell. That target takes an extra 3d6 necrotic damage.

results.1-1: The characters grew up in the same place and have known each other for years.
results.2-2: The characters have united to overcome a foe.
results.3-3: The characters were brought together by a common benefactor who wishes to sponsor their adventures.
results.4-4: A funeral brings the characters together.
results.5-5: A festival brings the characters together.
results.6-6: The characters find themselves trapped together.

Plant Desires.name: Plant Desires
Plant Desires.description: Some desired offering options for a plant.

results.1-1: A pound of mulch
results.2-2: Water from a spring infused with Feywild energy
results.3-3: Clearing invasive vegetation from the creature’s territory
results.4-4: Destroying all axes and fire-making implements the party carries

Primal Fruit Effects.name: Primal Fruit Effects
Primal Fruit Effects.description: Effects that can occur when interacting with primal fruits.

results.1-1: The creature regains [[/r 3d8 + 4]] hit points, and its skin sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet for 1 hour.
results.2-2: The creature feels a surge of might. For 1 hour, the creature has advantage on attack rolls using Strength, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws. When the effect ends, the creature gains 1 level of &Reference[exhaustion].
results.3-3: Waves of vitality crash over the creature. The creature’s hit point maximum increases by [[/r 2d10]], and it gains the same number of hit points. The increase lasts until the creature finishes a long rest, at which time the creature must succeed on a [[/save charisma dc=15]] saving throw or be cursed with a random form of lycanthropy (see “Lycanthropes” in the Monster Manual).
results.4-4: The creature’s skin prickles faintly. For 1 hour, it gains resistance to one damage type (chosen by the DM).
results.5-5: Euphoric visions of bright light swim through the creature’s mind. The creature gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.VtCXMdyM6mAdIJZb]{death ward} spell for 8 hours and must succeed on a [[/save constitution dc=13]] saving throw or be &Reference[poisoned] for the duration.
results.6-6: A faint humming drones in the background of everything the creature hears for 1 hour, during which the creature has advantage on saving throws against spells.
results.7-7: The creature doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep for [[/r 1d4]] days. For the duration, the creature can’t be put to sleep by magic, and its dreams intrude upon its waking thoughts, imposing disadvantage on its Wisdom (Perception) checks.
results.8-8: Whispers intrude on the creature’s mind for 24 hours. For the duration, the creature can telepathically communicate with any creature it can see within 120 feet of it. If the other creature understands at least one language, it can respond telepathically.

Psychic Resonance Effects.name: Psychic Resonance Effects
Psychic Resonance Effects.description: An effect that can occur when in a supernatural Psychic Resonance region.

results.1-6: One random creature in the region gains the ability to cast the detect thoughts spell (save DC 13) once over the next 24 hours, requiring no components. Intelligence is the spellcasting ability for this spell.
results.7-12: One random creature in the region is affected by the mind blank spell for the next 24 hours.
results.13-18: For 1 minute on initiative count 20 (losing all ties), Tiny and Small objects in the region that aren’t being worn or carried are flung by an unseen force. One random creature in the region must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d4 bludgeoning damage from the flung objects.
results.19-24: Memories become sharp and clear for 1 hour. During this time, each creature in the region adds double its proficiency bonus to Intelligence checks made to recall information.
results.25-34: Headaches and nosebleeds plague humanoids in the region, imposing disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks for 1 hour.
results.35-40: Psychic power builds in the mind of one random creature in the region. Once within the next minute, the creature can use a bonus action to magically assault the mind of another creature it can see. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or take 4d10 psychic damage.
results.41-46: Lurking fears become nightmares. Any creature that finishes a short or long rest in the region must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit for finishing the rest.
results.47-52: For 1 hour, each creature in the region gains the ability to communicate telepathically with any creature it can see within 60 feet. If the target understands any languages, it can respond telepathically.
results.53-58: One random creature in the region can sense the presence of nearby minds for 1 hour. For the duration, the creature gains advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to locate other creatures within 120 feet of it, even creatures behind total cover.
results.59-64: Creatures in the region suffer from disjointed thoughts and difficulty concentrating for 1 hour. For the duration, creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.
results.65-70: One random creature in the region hears strange whispers in its mind. The whispers are fragments of thoughts from other creatures nearby. The creature has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks for 1 hour.
results.71-76: One random creature in the region gains the ability to cast the telekinesis spell (save DC 15) once over the next 24 hours, requiring no components. Intelligence is the spellcasting ability for this spell.
results.77-82: Thoughts in the region attract ambient psychic energy, forming protective fields around creatures’ minds. Creatures in the region gain resistance to psychic damage for the next hour.
results.83-88: For 1 minute on initiative count 20 (losing all ties), one random creature in the region must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 2d6 psychic damage.
results.89-94: Compassion and joy fill the mind of one random creature in the region for 1 minute. For the duration, the creature has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and disadvantage on attack rolls.
results.95-100: The mind of every beast in the region is flooded with psychic energy. This energy causes each beast’s Intelligence score to become 10, if it wasn’t already higher, and the beast gains the ability to speak Common and Sylvan fluently. These changes are permanent.

results.1-1: Shadow Tongue. A mysterious speaker for your order advises your next steps but fears being discovered by a powerful rival faith.
results.2-2: Inspired Creator. A gifted artisan conveys the will of the divine through prophetic song or artwork.
results.3-3: Mysterious Text. The gradual translation of a secret holy text points you toward the next step of a divine destiny.
results.4-4: Fierce Inquisitor. A severe hierarch directs you to cleanse wickedness from a region, from the order, or from within yourself.
results.5-5: Beloved Healer. A famed healer guides you to where you’ll be needed most, even if their reasons are unclear until you arrive.
results.6-6: Divinity’s Voice. Otherworldly messages direct you to undertake divine quests.

results.1-1: Safe Escape. A band of the faithful wandered into territory hostile to your order. You must find them and escort them to safety.
results.2-2: Relic Recovery. You seek a lost symbol of the order discovered in a dangerous place or in the hands of an enemy.
results.3-3: Cult Hunt. You hunt a cell of zealots dangerous to your order or mortals at large.
results.4-4: Desperate Pilgrimage. You protect members of the order as they participate in a pilgrimage that takes them through dangerous lands.
results.5-5: Expunge Heresy. You seek out the source of blasphemy that’s taken root within the order.
results.6-6: Prevent Prophecy. A rival order stands on the cusp of fulfilling a prophecy with deadly ramifications. You strive to undermine their blasphemous agenda.

results.1-1: Undead Hunters. This community of scholars and monster hunters laboriously researches the unquiet dead, tracking them to their lairs and permanently laying them to rest.
results.2-2: Devout Scholars. This federation prizes knowledge and texts pertaining to their god. They collect rare holy books and record the life stories of miracle-working prophets.
results.3-3: Relic Collectors. This order of archaeologist-monks seeks to fill their museum-like temple with storied holy relics.
results.4-4: Charitable Missionaries. Adhering to the belief that religion empowers civilization, this order travels far to help the downtrodden, seeking to draw new believers by their virtuous example.
results.5-5: Militant Inquisitors. This dogmatically rigid hierarchy seeks to stamp out all threats to their beliefs.
results.6-6: Doomsaying Evangelists. This order believes the world is about to end. They’re convinced that if they persuade everyone else of this fact they might stave off the impending doom.

Souls of the Tarokka.name: Souls of the Tarokka
Souls of the Tarokka.description:
Prisoners of Fate. Whenever you use the Twist of Fate property, there is a chance that one of the souls trapped in the deck escapes. Roll [[/r d100]] and consult the Souls of the Tarokka table. If you roll one of the high cards, the soul associated with it escapes. You can find its statistics in the Monster Manual. If you roll a soul that has already escaped, roll again.

Foundry Note

This table has been configured to draw without replacement to represent the high card souls escaping. However, the result representing all other cards, 15 - 100, will always be replaced via included module functionality.

The released soul appears at a random location within [[/r 10d10#Miles]] miles of you and terrorizes the living. Until the released soul is destroyed, it gains the benefit of a weal from the deck’s Twist of Fate property, and both you and the original target of Twist of Fate suffer the effect of woe.

results.1-1: Flameskull
results.2-2: Wraith
results.3-3: Banshee
results.4-4: Vampire
results.5-5: Mummy
results.6-6: Death Knight

results.1-1: Intimate Confidant. The sovereign’s friend or lover seeks to aid their companion in any way possible.
results.2-2: Spymaster. An intelligence operative attends to the nation’s dirty work so the sovereign keeps their hands clean.
results.3-3: Administrator. This severe bureaucrat disagrees with many of the sovereign’s policies but takes loyal service seriously.
results.4-4: Executive Assistant. The responsibilities of an exacting butler or other servant at the royal household far exceed their title.
results.5-5: Envoy. A semi-retired, leisure-loving ambassador speaks in suggestion and innuendo.
results.6-6: Spectral Assembly. A ghostly council of the nation’s previous regents manifests to avert disasters.

results.1-1: International Espionage. You attempt to steal intelligence, national symbols, or super weapons from an enemy power.
results.2-2: Undermine Rival. You seek to weaken or remove a rival to the regent’s rule—perhaps a general, an archdruid, or a noble with a claim to the throne.
results.3-3: Expel Corruption. You help the sovereign reform their government, rooting out institutional vices.
results.4-4: Subvert Blame. The sovereign is caught in an embarrassing affair. Make it disappear.
results.5-5: Test Heir. You prepare the sovereign’s heir for the challenge of taking the throne.
results.6-6: Desperate Diplomacy. You seek to make peace with a force or entity that could wipe out your nation.

results.1-1: Village Elder. The wizened leader of a community offers both civic and moral leadership.
results.2-2: Young Noble. An ambitious noble eagerly seeks to reform society to align with a personal vision.
results.3-3: Shipwrecked Governor. A desperate leader struggles to keep people alive in a wilderness they’re not prepared to endure.
results.4-4: Ruler Returned. A tribe’s revered leader has returned from the dead and seeks to resurrect their past glories.
results.5-5: Hidden Power. A mysterious figure manipulates the nation’s puppet leader and guides the government’s true agenda.
results.6-6: True Regent. The rightful heir to the throne struggles to reclaim power from a perfect impostor.

Star Map Form.name: Star Map Form
Star Map Form.description: You’ve created a star chart as part of your heavenly studies. It is a Tiny object and can serve as a spellcasting focus for your druid spells. You determine its form by rolling on the Star Map table or by choosing one.

results.1-1: A scroll covered with depictions of constellations
results.2-2: A stone tablet with fine holes drilled through it
results.3-3: A speckled owlbear hide, tooled with raised marks
results.4-4: A collection of maps bound in an ebony cover
results.5-5: A crystal that projects starry patterns when placed before a light
results.6-6: Glass disks that depict constellations

Swarm Appearance.name: Swarm Appearance
Swarm Appearance.description: A swarm of intangible nature spirits has bonded itself to you and can assist you in battle. While you’re alive, the swarm remains in your space, crawling on you or flying and skittering around you within your space. You determine its appearance, or you generate its appearance by rolling on this table.

results.1-1: Swarming insects
results.2-2: Miniature twig blights
results.3-3: Fluttering birds
results.4-4: Playful pixies

results.1-1: Personal Mentor. This longtime member of the syndicate took you under their wing when you were young and became a parental figure.
results.2-2: Clever Urchin. An innocuous person, perhaps a beggar or menial laborer, knows all the right people and shares their connections with you.
results.3-3: Former Law Enforcement. Your contact used to be (or maybe still is) a member of local law enforcement. They have sharp insight into the law’s workings in your area and a healthy dose of paranoia for that reason.
results.4-4: Bon Vivant. The boss of a local den of vice—whether gambling, narcotics, or other pleasures—aids you when they’re not distracted by their own debauchery.
results.5-5: Traitor. You know your contact in the syndicate has betrayed it, but they have enough clout and leverage that you don’t dare cross them—yet.
results.6-6: Criminal Royalty. Unknown to most, your contact is a member of local nobility or royalty. Why they maintain relations with the syndicate is a troubling mystery.

results.1-1: Acquisition and Retrieval. You acquire assets for the syndicate. You steal important documents or clear out locations for use as hideouts.
results.2-2: Heists. You plan and execute elaborate robberies that require the combined skills of your team.
results.3-3: Gang Warfare. You ensure that no other crime syndicate gains a significant foothold in your territory.
results.4-4: Enforcement. You keep the corrupt, headstrong, and avaricious members of your syndicate in line with the goals and rules of the organization.
results.5-5: Assassination. You dispatch prominent people—the sort who have numerous bodyguards and elaborate security systems to circumvent.
results.6-6: Topple the Powerful. Your syndicate is criminal and your methods illegal, but your goals are righteous. You help people who are powerless against exploitation by the powerful.

results.1-1: Thieves’ Guild. A disparate convocation of thieves, spies, smugglers, and other scoundrels controls criminal activity in a region of a city.
results.2-2: Assassin Society. The network’s livelihood is death. Members of the society hone their skills as cutthroats, poisoners, body-disposal specialists, and any other profession focused on ending lives. The society is motivated by profit or labors in service to a greater cause.
results.3-3: Magical Arms Dealer. The syndicate has cornered the market on deadly magical devices. They offer their services and wares for a price and acquire staggering magical might for those who meet their demands.
results.4-4: Pirate Fleet. This alliance of pirate captains is unified under a ruling captain or admiral and adheres to a strict code of honor. They converge only in response to an outside threat.
results.5-5: Body Snatchers. The syndicate consists predominantly, if not entirely, of creatures that possess or impersonate other people. They seek to replace influential individuals throughout society with members of their ranks.
results.6-6: Thought Thieves. These psychic criminals infiltrate their target’s minds to steal secrets and disguise their existence.

results.1-1: The Staring Cats of Uldun-dar (ivory cat molar)
results.2-2: Duggle’s Surprising Day (human molar)
results.3-3: The Golden Age of Dhakaan (golden goblin bicuspid)
results.4-4: The Mill Road Murders (halfling canine)

results.6-6: The Stable Hand’s Secret (sweet-tasting human canine)
